name: Shenlong Wang
content: Shenlong Wang Shenlong Wang Email / Google Scholar I am an Assistant Professor at the UIUC Department of Computer Science, affiliated with Computer Vision @ UIUC, Illinois Robotics Group and Center for Immersive Computing @ UIUC. I finished my PhD at Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto and worked as a research scientist at Uber, advised by Raquel Urtasun. My research interests lie at the intersection of 3D computer vision and robotics. Our group's recent work focuses on three areas: (a) developing algorithms to perceive and model the 3D world, (b) creating realistic, physics-informed simulations based on real-world observations, and (c) exploring the application of modeling and simulation techniques in real-world domains such as robotics, autonomy, immersive computing, and agriculture in the context of climate change. Positions We are always looking for motivated students to join us. Prospective graduate students: please apply to the Ph.D. programs at UIUC CS/ECE and list me as a potential advisor. Current UIUC grad and undergrad students: please send me an email with your CV and transcript if you are interested. Visiting students: please send me your CV and transcript through email.
